Tien Yok Chong
Route Management

Southern Route (Marina Bay)

21 June, 2021

Overall Difficulty: Easy

Experience

This route is great for beginner runners and for any runner who wants to have a good run while taking in the scenic sights of the Marina Bay cityscape. This route is made for the classic Singapore night run.

Attractions / Perks

  • Includes scenic sights like the panoramic Singapore skyline

  • Ample rest points along the way

Challenges

  • Construction works along the trail may make navigation difficult

  • Slight elevation changes when using underpasses and bridges

  • Beware of cyclists along the Marina Bay Sands and Clarke Quay/Boat Quay areas especially where the paths are narrower

Landmarks

Summary

This route offers a completely different experience when you run it in the morning and at night! There are many spots along the way to rest at and so many views to take in as well. I would recommend running in the evening so that you can catch both the sunset and the nightscape.

References

  • Southern 3km Route (Marina Bay)

  • Southern 5km Route (Marina Bay)

  • Southern 10km Route (Marina Bay)
